results.content: Clean code. Great mini e-commerce app based on local json file and cool npm packages! Thx Reed!
results.content_html: Clean code. Great mini e-commerce app based on local json file and cool npm packages! Thx Reed!

results.content: That's a great course that really goes to the point. The final app is an ecommerce implemented using React + useQuery on the frontend and Express as the backend. As a payment method the app is integrated with Stripe and deployed in Heroku. Another great course by Reed!!
results.content_html: That's a great course that really goes to the point. The final app is an ecommerce implemented using React + useQuery on the frontend and Express as the backend. As a payment method the app is integrated with Stripe and deployed in Heroku. Another great course by Reed!!

results.content: After hunting for a tutorial that could help me with stripe's new way of payment processing and handling multiple items being purchased, this was the perfect tutorial!!
results.content_html: After hunting for a tutorial that could help me with stripe's new way of payment processing and handling multiple items being purchased, this was the perfect tutorial!!

results.content: Videos 1 and 2 seem like they are out of order.
results.content_html: Videos 1 and 2 seem like they are out of order.

results.content: I finished the whole course from start to finish in one go. For the content, yes, there are a lot of cool stuffs & Reed's courses has his own style and followers. Its not for beginners. No basics are covered ( should not be expected in a one & a half hour crash course ). Its for those people who knows Javascript, react fundamentals & a bit of node, who just wants to put those pieces together, and build up something cool under 2 hours. Is it complete? No. It can be a good base to begin with. It would have been better if there was a customer login, and populate the cart based on it. There are a few essential functionalities missing - Like remember card for future purchases, having a downloadable invoice etc which would have made this course even more awesome. I also learned new stuffs like react query, use shopping cart package etc and a full set of functionalities without redux. Overall, i loved it for a course under 1.5 hrs. Looking forward to see more functionalities added on to this in the future !
